column1: '''Dwaling''' was a village in the far Northern parts of the [[Eastfarthing]] of [[the Shire]]
column2: just north of the hills of [[Scary]].<ref>{{FR|Part}}</ref>
Tolkien said that ''Dwaling'' was a regular toponymic formation of a settlement's name
column3: "the descendants of ''Dwale''". ''Dwale'' would be a nick-name of one particular Hobbit
column4: and the name was derived from [[Old English]] ''dwale''
column6: Undated note part of ''[[Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings|Nomenclature]]''
column7: cited in [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]] (2008)
column8: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]''
column9: page lviii</ref> This name has been connected to ''[[Dwalak≈çneis]]''
column10: the [[Gothic]] translation of Tolkien's own name.<ref name="lviii"/><ref>[[Mark T. Hooker]]

column2: before the publication of the abovementioned note
column3: [[David Salo]] had suggested it is a form of "dwelling"

column2: towns and villages of the Shire]]
